name: AG-UI
summary: Perhaps the most Whitehead-like protocol in the stack — explicitly designed to keep humans in the loop. The 17 event types give users visibility into what agents are doing. But the risk is that 'human-in-the-loop' becomes performative — a rubber stamp rather than genuine oversight.

feedbackLoop.note: Excellent. 17 typed events (lifecycle, messages, tool calls, state) provide granular visibility.

edgeCases.note: Clean event model. Each type has a clear purpose.

ambiguity.note: Typed events eliminate ambiguity. STATE_DELTA uses JSON Patch — deterministic.

redundancy.note: Overlaps with A2UI. CopilotKit positions them as complementary but the boundary is blurry.

nesting.note: Flat event stream. No recursive nesting by design.

exitCost.note: Lightweight protocol. Multiple backend frameworks supported. Switching is feasible.

identityPenetration.note: Low. Developers see it as plumbing, not ideology.

agencyPreservation.note: Explicitly designed for human-in-the-loop. Users can interrupt, redirect, cancel.

controlInvisibility.note: Risk: as agents get better, humans may stop actually reading the event stream. Oversight becomes ritual.

crisisMindset.note: No urgency narrative. Positioned as pragmatic infrastructure.
